Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the first case Case 1 the path is OR MS QS AS IQC AS TST RT TST PK LB DP D but RT loops back to TST right Because after RT they go back to TST again So thats a loop between RT and TST Oh right the loop operator is used for that

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: the loop operator A B means execute A then either exit the loop or execute B and then A again repeating until the loop is exited So the loop is between RT and TST A as RT and B as TST

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: Or maybe the other way around Let me think the operator A B means after executing A you can either exit or go to B and then back to A again Wait but in the event log after TST first occurrence they do RT then go back to TST again So the loop is between RT and TST Or the other way around Hmm perhaps I need to structure it so that after TST you have a choice to either exit the loop or go back to RT

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: after AS theres a choice between doing IQC and looping back to AS or proceeding directly to TST as in case 4 they skip IQC and go directly to TST

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: the loop is AS followed by IQC So the loop node would be LOOP AS IQC Then after each AS you can choose to exit the loop or go to IQC and back to AS
